results.firPara: This was a victory to be cherished as much by those overseeing Fulhams academy as the management of a revived first-team. For the first time since the turn of the century, and admittedly after a lengthy spell in the top flight themselves, this club have beaten opponents from a higher division. That they did so with a youthful, virtually homegrown team merely added to the sense of achievement. Their kids are better than all right. The conveyor belt is gloriously productive.
results.secPara: It took a goal from Lasse Vigen Christensen, who had actually joined the youth ranks from Midtjylland at the age of 17, to see off a disjointed and disappointing Middlesbrough. The Dane sprinted into the clutter of the six‑yard box to poke in Scott Malones low centre, after excellent initial work from the young Luca de la Torre, seven minutes from the end of extra-time. In truth the whole contest ended up feeling like a prolonged tribute to the work of Huw Jennings and his coaching staff back at Motspur Park. Boro may have had the initial swagger and the weighty experience, but they were still eclipsed.
results.webTitle: Fulham grateful to Christensen as late winner does for Middlesbrough

results.firPara: • Wales manager surprised Ramsey played in Arsenals opening game
results.secPara: • Wales manager surprised Ramsey played in Arsenals opening game
results.webTitle: Chris Coleman questions whether Aaron Ramsey’s injury was preventable

results.firPara: Extra time was beckoning and the murmurings of discontent were becoming audible when, with one imperious swipe of his right foot, Adnan Januzaj dispersed the growing Wearside gloom.
results.secPara: The Manchester United loanees glorious turn and shot into the top corner from outside the area not only gave David Moyes his first win as Sunderlands manager but also offered reasonable compensation for a horribly laboured home performance from an extremely young side.
results.webTitle: Adnan Januzaj’s late goal earns Sunderland victory over Shrewsbury

results.firPara: If this is to prove Joe Harts swansong he was given a stylish send-off by Manchester City fans who left Pep Guardiola with zero doubt regarding their affection for the 29-year-old. On 65 minutes the support sang Stand up if you love Joe Hart and the Etihad Stadium rose to create a moment that was touching and one the under-pressure goalkeeper may never forget.
results.secPara: It was that kind of night throughout. The actual game was academic given the 5-0 lead City held over Steaua Bucharest from last weeks opening leg in Romania. Hart had finally been selected by the manager for the sides fourth match of the season, and asked to help seal a place for City in Thursdays Champions League group stage draw.
results.webTitle: Fabian Delph’s header helps Manchester City push past Steaua Bucharest

results.firPara: An exercise in fixture fulfilment brought little by way of entertainment or education. Delph scored a nice goal, Hart was lovingly acclaimed by the home fans, Kolarov performed with distinction alongside Stones and, on the down side, Iheanacho suffered an injury that could keep him out of action for a while.
results.secPara: 90+2 min Theres only one Joe Hart gets another airing from a smattering of home fans.
results.webTitle: Manchester City v Steaua Bucharest: Champions League play-off – as it happened

results.firPara: The Football Association has confirmed the appointment of Greg Clarke as its chairman, in succession to Greg Dyke, at a specially convened council meeting at Wembley, with the new man to take up the post just before Englands World Cup qualifier in Slovakia on 4 September.
results.secPara: Clarke, who was chairman of the Football League for six years, had been approved by the FAs board last month but was ratified in the role only on Wednesday. Clarke, who said he is delighted, will travel next weekend with Sam Allardyces senior squad to Slovakia, where the national team begin their Group F campaign at the Antona Malatinskeho stadium in Trnava.
results.webTitle: Greg Clarke ratified as FA chairman in succession to Greg Dyke

results.firPara: Mario Balotelli is understood to be weighing up a move to FC Sion after the Swiss clubs chairman confirmed they are in talks to sign the striker on loan from Liverpool.
results.secPara: The Italian has been training alone after being informed he is not in Jürgen Klopps plans for this season. Balotelli has been linked with a return to Italy having spent last season on loan at Milan, although proposed moves to Chievo and Sassulo have failed to materialise.
results.webTitle: Liverpool’s Mario Balotelli in talks with FC Sion over loan move

results.firPara: • Initial bid for Morocco forward was rejected by French club
results.secPara: Southampton are in negotiations with Lille over the transfer of Sofiane Boufal, with the clubs close to agreeing a deal that could be worth up to £21.2m (€25m) for the Morocco forward.
results.webTitle: Southampton in talks with Lille over £17m move for Sofiane Boufal

results.firPara: Chris Coleman has dismissed any possibility of the Football Association of Wales supporting Team GB entering football teams at future Olympic Games. The Wales manager said there was no appetite whatsoever within the FAW to embrace a tournament he fears would risk derailing their progress and mess about with the pride and identity his players feel when they represent the country.
results.secPara: Speaking in response to an issue that has returned to the agenda in recent days, partly through Sam Allardyce, the England manager, saying that he believes Team GB should field football teams at the next Olympics, Coleman made it clear he has no time for the idea.
results.webTitle: Chris Coleman dismisses idea of Wales being part of Team GB at Olympics

results.firPara: The US international fought back from a bad start during his loan at Sunderland. But he simply wasnt being given an opportunity in north London
results.secPara: The US international fought back from a bad start during his loan at Sunderland. But he simply wasnt being given an opportunity in north London
results.webTitle: DeAndre Yedlin had to leave Tottenham to fulfil his promise
